intro: Galium sylvestre subsp. bocconei, commonly known as the Boccone's wood cranesbill, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and opposite, lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native habitat.
